note.p: Education: Malvern College; Mason College (later Birmingham University). MA (Camb); DSc (Birm)

Career: Forster Scholar studying optical rotation (1898-1900); research assistant to Sir Joseph John Thomson (FRS 1884), Cavendish Laboratory, Cambridge; Royal Aircraft Establishment, Farnborough (during World War 1); Research Fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge (1920); member of eclipse expeditions
Medals/Prizes: Hughes Medal 1922; Royal Medal 1938; Nobel Prize (Chemistry) 1922
AssocMaterial: NCUACS 101/6/01. Papers deposited Cambridge University Library (covering the period 1911-1945)
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1945-1948 vol 5 pp 635-650, plate, by G Hevesy
